title: Strictly’s Craig Revel Horwood begs Bruno Tonioli to stop posting nude snaps
text:

Strictly Come Dancing judge Craig Revel Horwood has begged his fellow judge Bruno Tonioli to stop posting shirtless selfies.

63-year-old Bruno often takes to Instagram to show off his tanned and toned physique in skimpy speedos and tiny sets of underwear.

In an interview with the Daily Star this week, Craig admitted he thinks it’s time for the Italian to "learn to start covering up" as he slams him for being "in love with himself".

Craig told the publication: "He had a good body when he was in Elton John's I'm Still Standing video but that was 30 years ago, darling."

(Image: COPYRIGHT UNKNOWN)

(Image: SOPA Images/LightRocket via Gett)

He continued to swipe at his co-star: "There should be a limit to what he is showing people, I think.

"Bruno is in love with himself and his body. He thinks he has got the body of a 23-year-old."

In one incredibly cheeky snap, the Italian born dancer can be seen waltzing around in minuscule pants.

The chatty choreographer fondly gripped hold of his dear female friend Kelly Hoppen's hand as they posed for a fun picture.

Bruno often shares underwear-clad snaps with his 210K followers on social media.

Bruno missed out on judging in Strictly last week and was replaced by Alfonso Ribeiro as he was busy filming in America on Dancing With The Stars.

The judge returned for Halloween week, which saw Catherine Tyldesly shockingly eliminated from the show.

Harsh-talking judge Craig recently made headlines after he hit back at the public outcry following Catherine's controversial exit from the BBC dance competition.

Speaking to Mirror Online at the recent Pride Of Britain Awards 2019, the judge bragged he was happy with the result despite the public anger.

The Strictly star called the public out for not filing their votes.

(Image: Roland Leon Sunday Mirror)

He said: "Yeah I was [happy with the result]. The public weren't. I just say vote, you must vote. The public have 50% of the vote, not just four of us."

Craig's swipe back at the public come after head judge Shirley Ballas received death threats from online trolls following Dev Griffin's Strictly departure.

Strictly Come Dancing continues this Saturday.
description: Craig Revel Horwood has begged fellow Strictly judge Bruno Tonioli to stop flashing his pants on social media.
